thread.title: Wallabies, Waratahs utility Rob Horne signs three-year deal with Northampton Saints
thread.title_full: Wallabies, Waratahs utility Rob Horne signs three-year deal with Northampton Saints

author: Georgina Robinson
title: Wallabies, Waratahs utility Rob Horne signs three-year deal with Northampton Saints
text:
Barba makes shock switch to rugby Barba makes shock switch to rugby 
NRL star Ben Barba has signed a deal with French rugby powerhouse Toulon until the end of the season. Vision courtesy Seven Network . More videos South Africa take gold, Australia fourth 
South Africa dominated England in the Sydney Sevens final to win gold while New Zealand beat Australia again to pick up bronze. 
He has not played enough Tests in the gold jersey to qualify for selection overseas under the so-called Giteau Law, which mandates a 60-Test threshold for players contracted overseas. 
It is understood Horne will play out the Super Rugby season for the Waratahs and depart for England after the Rugby Championship finishes at the end of September. Related Content Brumbies suffer another injury blow in last trial 
Northampton are sitting in sixth position on the Premiership table. Horne will be coached by Jim Mallinder and play alongside Test stars George North (Wales), England captain Dylan Hartley, England centre Luther Burrell and second rower Courtney Lawes. 
It is the second time Horne has been courted heavily by a European club. Two years ago the long-time Waratah took some time to reject a deal with an Irish club before re-signing with NSW and the Australian Rugby Union for two years. Advertisement 
"Like any major decision, money is certainly part of it, but it's not the be all and end all," Horne told News Ltd at the time. 
"It's not a business decision; it's a rugby decision and a life decision. SHARE
